column3: No, it should not, we use SI units (kB, MB) everywhere not MiB, KiB.\n
Nit: KB is unambiguously 1024 bytes. The SI unit is kB (lowercase k).\n
dbcache size and network traffic use MiB, KiB.\n

For dbcache size it's for specific database implementation reasons, if I remember correctly.

For network traffic we shouldn't be using MiB, KiB at all! If that is the case, feel free to change it.
it need to change lots of code (include resource of QT), and debug it in Linux, i don't have enough ablity and time to change it, sorry!\n
